meanings.definition: A person who behaves in a dishonorable or contemptible way.
meanings.sent1: The blackguard stole money from the charity.
meanings.sent2: Don't trust that blackguard; he lies to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The blackguard tried to cheat in the game, but got caught.
meanings.sent4: His actions painted him as a blackguard among his peers.
meanings.sent5: The town knew him as the blackguard who never kept his promises.

meanings.definition: To criticize or denounce in scathing terms.
meanings.sent1: She blackguards anyone who disagrees with her opinions.
meanings.sent2: The journalist blackguarded the politician in her article.
meanings.sent3: He blackguards his own cooking skills, but everyone loves his dishes.
meanings.sent4: The teacher blackguarded the student's lazy attitude in front of the class.
meanings.sent5: The coach blackguards the players to push them to improve their performance.
